verses.translation: By the night when it covers
And [by] the day when it appears
And [by] He who created the male and female,
verses.transliteration: Wa maa khalaqaz zakara wal unthaa

verses.translation: Indeed, your efforts are diverse.
As for he who gives and fears Allah
And believes in the best [reward],
We will ease him toward ease.
But as for he who withholds and considers himself free of need
And denies the best [reward],
We will ease him toward difficulty.

verses.arabic: وَمَا یُغۡنِی عَنۡهُ مَالُهُۥۤ إِذَا تَرَدَّىٰۤ
verses.translation: And what will his wealth avail him when he falls?
verses.transliteration: Wa maa yughnee 'anhu maaluhooo izaa taraddaa

verses.translation: Indeed, [incumbent] upon Us is guidance.
And indeed, to Us belongs the Hereafter and the first [life].
verses.transliteration: Wa inna lanaa lal Aakhirata wal oolaa

verses.translation: So I have warned you of a Fire which is blazing.
None will [enter to] burn therein except the most wretched one.
Who had denied and turned away.
But the righteous one will avoid it -
[He] who gives [from] his wealth to purify himself

verses.arabic: وَمَا لِأَحَدٍ عِندَهُۥ مِن نِّعۡمَةࣲ تُجۡزَىٰۤ
verses.translation: And not [giving] for anyone who has [done him] a favor to be rewarded
verses.transliteration: Wa maa li ahadin 'indahoo min ni'matin tujzaaa

verses.translation: But only seeking the countenance of his Lord, Most High.
And he is going to be satisfied.
